quest.name: The Key to Victory
journal: Alphinaud remains concerned for his dear friend.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Cotter built those walls to give shelter to his brothers and sisters. And now our people's freedom rests on us tearing them down...

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Most of the Ala Mhigans in the residential district are Aan, so I doubt we'll have to deal with many imperial sympathizers.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: The battle for Castrum Abania was brutal, but the one for Ala Mhigo will be unlike any we have ever known...

dialogue.name: VMAHTIA
dialogue.text: The end is in sight. It has been a long time coming...

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: "A storm of blood approaches fast... Hells open, Heavens weep...“

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: For all our other accomplishments, Krile remains in the hands of our enemy, and I find myself wondering if we─if I could have done more. Though we know now that she was taken to the city, we have found nothing which might tell us where she is being held.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You know, you could just ask me.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thancred! What have you learned?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I shall spare you the particulars of my infiltration and simply state that I have seen her with my own eyes. She is being held within the residential district south of the city proper.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I tracked her to the ruins of an old temple of the Fist of Rhalgr, within which the imperials have constructed a research facility...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A research facility? What manner of research?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Why...methods to imbue Garleans with the power to manipulate aether. In pursuit of which goal, their scientists have, I am sorry to report, performed many questionable experiments─on living subjects.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Calm down, Alphinaud. We've already been tasked with securing the Ala Mhigan Quarter. This just gives us a reason to do it faster.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I entered and exited the facility by stowing aboard imperial transports, but that method is not suitable for a larger force.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And it goes without saying that a direct assault on the rather substantial main gates would be ill-advised.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: I think I might know someone who can help.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: One of my men. He had an idea about how to get into the city─ Actually, it might be best if I let him explain it himself.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: (-Cynical Youth-)It's been a while. I'll not take offense if you don't remember. Might even be glad of it.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: ...Ala Gannha, am I right?

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Aye. Wiscar's the name. I was raised in the Peaks, but my mum grew up in the city.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Er...anyroad, I reckon we can get inside the Ala Mhigan Quarter by way of Loch Seld.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: What? How?

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: It was a story my mum told us which made me think of it. She was always going on about what life was like when she was a girl, see...how they used to have to boil the water from the well before they could drink it, since it was full of salt─

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: They were drawing saltwater from the lochs! Which means that there must be an underwater tunnel or something.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Aye, that's it. But it won't be as simple as going for a swim.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: The well was closed, see. Apparently, Theodoric decided one day he wanted to control the water supply and forbade water trading. So even if you come up through it, you'll find yourself on the wrong side of a locked gate.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: At the time, my grandfather, being an enterprising sort, befriended a guard and lifted the key from his belt. He made a copy and carried on selling water until the imperials invaded, and he ended up working at the Saltery...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: In short, we need your grandfather's key. Assuming he still has it.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: I'm certain he does. And I can take you to him. But it'll be dangerous.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Don't you worry about that. We're used to dangerous.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Naago and Arenvald will assemble a squadron while the rest of us go and get that key.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Had I judged it possible to rescue her myself, I would have. But there were too many guards; too many ways it could have ended badly. I knew at once I would need your help.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Meffrid told me about your time in Ala Gannha─how a certain someone gave you a piece of his mind when you first met. Try not to hold it against him.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: If there's a chance we can rescue Krile, I want to be involved. I owe her that much.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hold on, Krile. We're coming...

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: We couldn't've had more than a few days' training when the imperials attacked the Reach, but I've seen my share of combat since! I may be no hero like you, but I can hold my own against imperial regulars─you'll see!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Let's not waste any more time, then, shall we?

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: My mum said Grandad kept the key with him at all times as a lucky charm. If he hasn't got it, then, well...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text:
Then we'll cross that bridge when we come to it.
Ready, Forename? We may have to deal with a few imperial patrols, or worse...

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: This is it. This is the monastery. They have to be around here somewhere...

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Watt! Watt! It's me, Wiscar! Your grandson!

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: ...Wiscar? By Rhalgr, is that really you?

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: ...Oh, it's good to see you alive and well, lad! But who are these other ones?

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: The Resistance, Grandad. My, er...my comrades-in-arms.

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: She told you all about me thumbing my nose at the mad king, did she? Heh. Daft sods never caught me neither...

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: It wasn't much, but it was my way of rebelling against his rule. Glad to see you've got higher aspirations. Here─make our family proud.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: I will, I swear! Rhalgr as my witness!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The revolutionary spirit runs in the family, I see.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: I'll make him proud. I'll make them all proud!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We should go. Arenvald and the others are waiting.

dialogue.name: WATT
dialogue.text: If I were ten years younger...but I'm not. Look after my grandson.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I was worried when he wasn't at the Saltery. But we found him in the end.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Now that we've got the key, it's time to find that underwater tunnel!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Wiscar's Vitality

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: The Saltery's not far. Follow me!

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: We're here, but...this isn't right. Where is everyone?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Word of the Alliance's advance has surely reached their ears. Mayhap they sought refuge elsewhere? We should search the buildings for clues.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In the wake of the ambush, you find a diary belonging to a laborer. The last entry makes mention of a plan to take shelter in the Sali Monastery...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The barrel appears to have recently been filled with fish packed in salt. Someone was hard at work less than a week ago...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The crumbling masonry appears to have lain undisturbed for some time...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The pot is filled to the brim with salt from the lochs...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The lumber appears to have lain undisturbed for some time...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The magitek device suddenly springs to life, flashing brightly and emitting a shrill sound. It's a trap!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: All right, which one of you triggered the obvious trap!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: On your guard! Magitek drones approaching!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Mayhap...half a dozen? Forename─keep Wiscar alive, would you?

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Seven hells! I could do with some help here!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Now then, where were we? Ah, yes, looking for clues as to the whereabouts of our erstwhile water merchant and his key...

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: The Sali Monastery! That's to the south. I'll lead the way!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Not after that ambush you won't! It's too dangerous! Forename, we'll follow you. Keep your eyes peeled for more magitek!

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: The monastery is just past that gate. Keep going!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Hm. Something tall, dark and imperial appears to be blocking the entrance.

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Godsdammit! I don't think there's a way round...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Then we'll just have to go through him!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Look! I think those two devices are shield generators!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I will keep the machine occupied. Forename, be a darlinggood chap and destroy the generators before it rips my head off.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Tis done! See how it falters! Belabor the brute!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: He won't be getting up after that! Now, let's find our man!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ugh, that will leave a mark...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Confound it...

dialogue.name: WISCAR
dialogue.text: Just when I was getting the hang of it...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You've ruined everything...
